messages.msgSnippet: Tracy, Hi again!  I just read your post (LOL)!  Because she is so funny, I guess I had you pictured more as Tracy Allman!  (I m not sure if I have her last
messages.messageBody:
Tracy,
Hi again! I just read your post (LOL)! Because she is so funny, I guess
I had you pictured more as Tracy Allman! (I'm not sure if I have her last
name spelled right) I used to watch her tv show a few yrs back! Anyway,
keep in touch ! :) Karen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] champagne moment...
messages.msgSnippet: Stephanie,  I don t know if you have ever nursed before,  but in my experience, it has been wonderful.  We adopted our first child, and he was bottle fed.  My
messages.messageBody:
Stephanie, I don't know if you have ever nursed before, but in my
experience, it has been wonderful. We adopted our first child, and he was
bottle fed. My second and third child are "home grown" , and I nursed my son
who is now 3 for almost 2 yrs., and my daughter who is now almost 7 mos.
nurses now. She eats some solids now, but not a great deal yet. I have
never joined the LLL, but I have thought about it before. If you never
nursed before, you will probably find it easier than making bottles--
especially at night. And as an added bonus, it really helps burn off the
pregnancy weight! :)

Karen
